website_summaries.verdict: Will give you the power you need for all kinds of batteries with a short charge time.
pros: With 1.5 Amp output, you'll be able to charge your batteries fast
Design of the trickle charger is waterproof, making it great for working in poor weather
Includes protection during the charge process for the battery
Ships with both alligator clips and ring connectors to match your battery
cons: Some customers report failure of the unit after only using a few times

customer_reviews.title: Works with larger power wheel batteries .
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly just as described. I use it to charge the 22 amp motorcycle battery that I have in my little girls jeep power wheel. Works fully automatically, I don’t have to disconnect it when it is done charging it automatically goes to a trickle charge and it stays connected until my little girl uses it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great charger, first failed but great customer support.
customer_reviews.text: We use this charger to charge our kid's power wheels, and it works great. We throw this charger on after they've ridden, and the next morning they are ready to go again. Ours totally died after a couple months of use, and our seller (Shenzhen Leicester Tech) replaced it with zero effort on our prat. Very much appreciated the good customer service. Assuming that first one going bad was a fluke, so giving 5-stars. If this one also fails, I'll come back and edit the review.
customer_reviews.author: mpat

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for maintaining lead acid batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and may by more. I use them to maintain the batteries on seldom used vehicles. There is a slight variation between units when tested on the same battery. One maintains the battery at 13.59V while the other at 13.68. However these are within recommended values so overall I am very pleased! The charge current is pulsed at about 5 HZ which is better than constant trickle
customer_reviews.author: lapsmith

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up and use. I thought I might need a new battery, but no, just a few hours of this charger and winter was put away! Simple to use and worked well. Recommend this for charging, recharging, or as a method to maintain your batteries. Works on either 6 or 12 volt batteries
customer_reviews.author: vietvet1369

customer_reviews.title: Great little charger!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and does it well, the indicator lights are a great feature. I bought mine to charge a 6v 4.5 amp battery for an Omnibot. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: double the usual amperage
customer_reviews.text: This has double the amps as the battery tender jr, good for larger motorcycle batteries, I even use it on my truck and jeep, I have a bike that has a rather large draw due to a lot of added accessories, this kept up with it while the batt tender could not. also has 6v
customer_reviews.author: Mark Littleton

customer_reviews.title: Good float charger
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this about 3 weeks now. Charger came with hookup for battery and standard battery clips. I've used it on 3 different motorcycles and it worked great. One of the batteries was down to 11.2V (no load) before I connected this charger and I left it attached for 2 weeks. I monitored the battery voltage (and touch temperature) during that time and it did an excellent job of NOT overcharging. I would buy this again, but I tend to ride all of my motorcycles so don't need more than 1. I have recommended it to my riding buddies.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Reconditioned a battery that would not charge
customer_reviews.text: This trickle charger already paid for itself by reconditioning a battery that would not charge. Very easy to use, everything is automatic, just make sure you have a good connection and that you have the charger connected properly before you plug it in. I plan on securing this charger to my riding mower so that after mowing I can just plug it in and it the battery will be properly maintained.
customer_reviews.author: FormosaTiger

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this battery charger fast and it was my fault for not paying attention to the name brand. I was beat and okay with it. This product look VERY similar to a "Battery Tender" brand charger. When I received the charger, the clamp terminals plastic insulator is flimsy and not fastened well to the terminal. The problem is this battery charger defaults to 12v when it is unplugged and plugged back in, or in my case the power went out while I was at work charging a 6v battery. Came home to a fried battery, corroded charging terminals and battery acid all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool little charger
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. Unlike the really cheap one I bought from Harbor Freight, this one charged up a completely dead battery on a quad. Comes with a harness, a set of clamps and an extension cable for the DC side. I’m not sure if anyone has 6 volt batteries any more but if you do, this thing has a setting! It seems a little more cheaply made than my Battery Tender brand but I don’t see a problem with that since this is less expensive than the BT and comes with clamps & extension that the BT does not. I’m buying another one for the riding mower.
customer_reviews.author: Moore

customer_reviews.title: Got one charge out of it...
customer_reviews.text: Charged one 6V battery successfully. After that, nothing. It now puts out a maximum of 1.38 volts. I don't have more that the one opportunity to test it before the return window closed, but can't recommend for anything more than providing one charge. .. then none.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple, easy.
customer_reviews.text: Using it currently to keep my battery up to charge in my seldom used “toad” that sits in the drive waiting for a chance to get pulled behind my RV. For the past few months it has performed well, battery is still fully charged. Easy to install, with two seperate ends and a quick disconnect plug to attach to the charger. Mounted one end permantly on the toad’s battery terminals, the other end has clamps so you can attach to any other battery later. Bright LED indicators lights on the charger give good indication of how it is working.
customer_reviews.author: jim chemsak

customer_reviews.text: I bought this to maintain my RV battery. The instructions say what the lights mean, well mine both lights are lit, so i don't know if the battery is charged or still charging. Apparently they mean not charged because i installed it in my RV and my meter is reading 2/3 charged. So i will be buying a new charger, but not from here.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Confusing
customer_reviews.text: I found the instructions confusing, they appear to be written by someone not completely literate in the English Language. And, the LED lite symbols on the charger did not match the illustrations in the instructions. Consequently, I was not sure when the battery was completely charged. I was charging a small, 6 volt, motorcycle battery, and I just left it on the charger for 36 hours. I do believe the charger will be completely adequate for maintaining the battery on my not frequently used trail bike.
customer_reviews.author: STANLEY H BEECH

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and spend it on a different brand / charger. This one does not work. I tried charging of my riding mower but it did not charge. Even after leaving it connected over a few days. When I checked the output voltage using a multi-meter, it showed around 1.4 volts. No where near the voltage needed to charge even a 6 volt battery let alone a 12 volt one.
customer_reviews.author: reefguy

customer_reviews.title: So far, So good.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these chargers to maintain my jetski batteries. After replacing the batteries at $100 ea, I wanted to extend the new batteries life as long as I could. So far, this charger has worked flawlessly. Comes with two attachment options to connect the charger. Clamps and a direct connect cable that you leave attached to the battery. Indicator lights are very simple to understand, no set up just plug it in and attach to battery using your preferred method.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Farabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Price was great, showed up overnight
customer_reviews.text: Price was great, showed up overnight, and so far, is working well. I've been using some 1 amp maintainers to maintain my motorcycle batteries through the winter (my bikes are outside in a unheated covered shed), and the 1 amp chargers just barely keep up, and sometimes don't. The bike I've got this on now, fires right up. Thinking about buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: daryl

customer_reviews.title: Product seems to work well, manual needs some work ...
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to work well, manual needs some work.The LED light system for the charge status seems a bit confusing. I am so accustom to blinking lights meaning it's charging. In this case it seems blinking lights mean it is complete, at either the 50 percent or 100 percent stage. Had to dust off the old Voltmeter just to be sure it was complete. Anyways, I charged a 12V motorcycle battery from near 0 volts to just about 12.8 volts approximately 14 hours. Product seems safe and reliable, time will tell. For my needs (generator battery) it just might do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Great idea, piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to keep the car battery up while we were wintering in Fla. All newer cars have electronics in them that continually draw power to keep their memory up (radio, ECM, etc.). Came back to a totally dead battery. Checked the output voltage of the unit and there was none. Ford's brilliant engineers saw fit to put a cap over the key lock assembly, which I found extremely difficult to remove (Yea, I watched the YouTube video on how to get it off, still miserable task). To say I am terribly disappointed in this item is putting it mildly. Don't waste your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Bob

customer_reviews.title: A serious design flaw. Don't use for 6V battteries!
customer_reviews.text: This unit defaults to 12Volts on power up which is fine when you're charging those. If you unplug and replug it, it again wants you to set the charging voltage up. I'm trying to charge 6V batteries. In case of a power failure and restore, these units could potentially blow my batteries up. Thatt's a major flaw.
customer_reviews.author: RemcoW

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use with 6 or 12 volt batteries. long leads which is nice because it plugs into the wall and does not have a cord to plug into the wall. the SAE connector is great I have one on each battery so I can hook of the changer easy and know it is plugged in and will not come off
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Still

customer_reviews.title: Winter perfect...
customer_reviews.text: ...if you have a riding mower sitting in the shed for the winter, this battery 'up-keeper' is a must have. It's not for use as an instant battery charger (for a dead car battery for instance) but it keeps my 12v riding mower battery 100% charged 100% of the time. It self adjusts, so you can leave it attached all winter. I run the mower's engine for a minute every month or so just to keep the oil and gas stabilizer circulating. I assume it would work well for a stored car battery, too. For the price, the 'Trickle Charger' can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: StephLadder

customer_reviews.title: We didn't know what was wrong with our riding lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: Had a new battery and only worked once. Replaced a lot of parts. The mower had been given to us and we were afraid it might not go again. A friend came over to look at it - and tried float charger on it. And it worked, so we came in saw this one - it had a video and the man doing the video said it worked great with riding lawn mowers - that older ones needed a float charger to keep them running - so we ordered it - and our mower is running when ever we need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Fandom

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly worked on a totally dead battery.!
customer_reviews.text: My friend haven't used his car for almost a year and he forgot to disconnect the battery. So the battery went dead and badly corroded. I helped him save the battery by cleaning it up ; adding battery solutions and charging it with this product. It took me about 1.5 days to charge the battery and i had it connected for a week just to observed if the product will work. Amazingly after putting the battery back in the car; it started it. Yehey! Work as described. One of the cheapest battery charger and maintainer.
customer_reviews.author: Jhen

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: First off all I just want to say, Fast delivery! Thank you. I tried it on a truck battery that had been dead for about a week. So i used this battery maintainer and it worked beautifully. I put the battery to charge while I went out to do some errands and it took me a couple of hours. By the time I got back, I tried starting up the truck and it it started right up. Have not tried leaving the charger on all night , will try it later. But it WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: JAG

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Maintainer/Charger
customer_reviews.text: I have a tree farm in Florida and I'm only there every other weekend. I had Battery Tender brand chargers before but they all died after 12 - 14 months. I hook them up to my tractors, side by side, boat and riding mower. All equipment is outside under pole barn. I guess to damp for Battery Tender. So far these are holding up well. This was the fourth one I purchased after the last Battery Tender died. I really like the extension cable that comes with the charger, made it easier to hook up where I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Charger
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to hold the battery on the motorcycle during the winter when it’s too cold to ride. It works great. I have a pig tail on my bike but the device has a few ways you can connect to your battery. This product will slow charge a dead battery that’s still good (as mine was) and then switch to maintain the battery after (as it does mine). Strongly recommend if you have to charge your battery after it’s been sitting. Definitely a good gift for riders. I would recommend getting the pig tail hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Fe

customer_reviews.title: Won't resurrect dead batteries, but works well as designed
customer_reviews.text: I had a battery that was dead as dead can get but after giving it a little jumpstart power, this charging unit kicked right in. So if you have a dead battery, give it a little life and then plug this in. The instructions tell you it won't charge a dead battery and that's for liability / safety reasons and not a design flaw. This will not permanently mount the wiring to a side post battery and I had to use the clips.
customer_reviews.author: kristofuh

customer_reviews.title: Does not go into trickle / maintain mode
customer_reviews.text: This charger would never go into trickle/maintain mode, connected it to a new 12v AGM riding lawnmower battery, left it hooked up for 3 days and the green light remained blinking indicating charging mode but never went solid indicating trickle mode. Disappointed, really wanted this to work, will have to go back to the less powerful Battery Tender Jr. now, have used those for years and never had an issue with them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Good Charger; but, Veritably Indecipherable Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Works as hoped; and, defaults to proper charging for small 12V battery. Manual override also available for 6V battery. Just don't count on the instruction sheet for any form of even semi-usable product guidance. Pictures and descriptions don't match; and, intentions behind or direction of narrative will likely leave you baffled.
customer_reviews.author: Back-up Guy

customer_reviews.title: Stability over time
customer_reviews.text: I use 6 volt and 12 volt SLA batteries externally with my trail cameras. I used the LST trickle charger on both for recharging. It works fine on the 12 volt SLA batteries,but a peculiar problem has me wondering. After the 6 volt SLA is charged to a point where the lst should be in the maintain mode, the LST charger automatically jumps to the 12 volt charge cycle. It then proceeds to charge the 6 volt SLA battery to 7.4 volts or possibly higher had I not returned to see what was happening. The instruction manual does not address that problem.
customer_reviews.author: acamus

customer_reviews.title: Great device - works and lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I own a bunch of these, use them on anything that doesn’t get regular use. I use these on the gasoline engines engines ( from mower and atv to autos) and the bigger model on our diesel equipment. All work flawlessly! Some older batteries seem to actually work better, probably as a result of the conditioning factor of these. My battery supplier is the only one who doesn’t like them - cuts into his sales!
customer_reviews.author: John Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be good product.  Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: Just received. Tested on a battery and monitored with a volt meter. Apprears to work as advertised. My concern is longevity as i have had many different units and most fail within a year or two. Nice touch suppling various length cables to comply with customers needs. Charge indicators a benefit. So far so good. Time will tell. Price highly competitive with similiar products. Appears to be a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: bcook

customer_reviews.title: Spin the Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I installed one on elderly neighbors vehicle about 2 1/2 months ago. It seems to be working fine. I decided to buy one for me because of the corona virus and greatly reduced driving. I have a Honda Element and a Nissan Altima. I attached it to the element and when the charger indicated the battery was fully charged I detached it and attempted to start the vehicle. However the battery was completely dead. when checked the battery had bulged and battery acid came out. Obviously I had to replace the battery. When I hooked it up to the Altima it seem to work OK. The damaged battery was older, but both were working when the charger was attached.
customer_reviews.author: Simonsays

customer_reviews.title: It's doing the job, even out in light rain.
customer_reviews.text: The cables remain flexible in cold weather. I've had it a couple of months and it's keeping the 6 Volt 600CCA battery on my 1959 Ford 671 tractor fully charged, but not overcharged. The indicator lights show what function it's doing, and the status of the charge. It's ensuring my confidence and security in the ability to use my tractor every day, all year-round. A good small investment for me.
customer_reviews.author: American worker/consumer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, falls apart easily.
customer_reviews.text: Used for charging car battery. Extremely slow, even for a trickle charger. Plastic handles on terminal clamps fell apart and fell off, exposing bare metal. Clamps were cross wired. Seems very finicky for clamp connection to + and - terminals. Clamps too small and does not fulfill connection even when hanging onto the terminal.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: These battery chargers work great, and the indicators are easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: These battery chargers work great , and the indicators are easy to understand
customer_reviews.author: K jackson

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My older Camry has drained its battery twice during the SIP. Since my other car is a hybrid, I cannot use it to jumpstart another car. For <$20 I can keep my battery charged and ready. I can plug it in and forget it. I gave 0 stars for "Warmth" because I don't know what that has to do with this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the small size of this charging unit. I was thinking it would sit on a surface, have a chord that gets plugged in, and of course the charging leads. Well, the unit itself is small enough that it is the thing that plugs into an outlet. Easy to follow instructions, very easy settings/connections - and let it do its thing. It did exactly what it was supposed to do. I have a fully charged battery and now I'm good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz from VN

customer_reviews.title: Small Charger Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to read the tiny printing on the instructions. This is not a product that will go over well with the older buyers in the USA. We have used it on several different batteries; a 12 volt wet cell and a 12 volt sealed lead acid type and it worked effectively. If only we were able to read how to safely use this electrical product....
customer_reviews.author: batteryBob

customer_reviews.title: Works As Specified.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars because the first charger I received was factory damaged. Case was split open at the seam, and I was forced to return it to Amazon for a refund. But the seller went out their way to make it right. They were so concerned with my satisfaction that they sent me a new one free, and it is working properly and good quality. Obviously their customer service and satisfaction are top notch. I commend them for their efforts to insure my satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Heyspock

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: It will take forever to charge a car battery from dead but I mainly bought it to charge those small non-spillable batteries. Pros: Works at charging just like it claims Cons: Takes a looooong time even for a small 8ah battery Cons #2: My battery was rated at 12 volts and the charger charged it to 13.1 Volts - 13.5 Volts. Is this a flaw of the device that it will overcharge a battery a bit? Who knows; but so far so good and it will be interesting to see if this unit lasts and performs to expectations.
customer_reviews.author: drunkspider

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to maintain a charge of the battery one of my cars. It was easy to use and hook up an dis doing an outstanding job maintaining the battery. Would definitely recommend this product for anyone who has a vehicle, boat, or whatever to insure the battery maintains the proper charge. What is nice about this product is that it will work on either 6 volt or 12 volt batteries systems..
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stemen

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Saw a device like this in an auto store for twice the price. Figured I'd check Amazon forest and I'm glad I did. My car runs good except over a few months the battery seems to get low enough to not start. Figure there's a drain somewhere or my alternator isn't functioning properly. In the meantime while I figure it out this keeps my battery at a full charge
customer_reviews.author: Furyus01

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this to charge my riding lawn mower and it was simple to use and works great. I can keep this connected and let it maintain my battery. I did try this on my truck battery while i was outside working in the yard. My truck batter was low and when i connected this up it was bellow 50% and it charged for 8 hours and brought it up to the above 50% zone...it was not finished charging. I did not want to leave it outside all night so i unplugged it. I am happy with it, because it was inexpensive and i needed it my riding lawn mover and it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ruszkowski, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Tender Works
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think it was working at first when the major charge light didn’t switch to minor charge for two days. Then it changed over & made me a believer. Then after unhooking & driving around I noticed the charge gauge was way down for some time. Bottom line: it works given time & is worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: randy painter

customer_reviews.title: Charger stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the charger in January 2020 to maintain a deep cycle 12v battery, and it worked great for several months. Gradually I noticed that the battery was showing less voltage after charging. I checked the in-line fuse on the charger and it was fine. I then tried another 12v battery charger to make sure the issue was with this trickle charger, and it worked as designed. After checking the charger output, it puts out a maximum of @ 1.2 volts (meaning it does not work properly). Too late to return. Save your money and go with a name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Beware of 12v default
customer_reviews.text: This will not select voltage on it's own so beware! We have cooked 2 6v batteries with it because if there is a power outage it will default to 12v. You would think that they would build in the lower voltage as a safety feature having not set it up to read what it is hooked up to. Decent little charger otherwise, but 6v batteries cost more than it so it's gonna have to be put out of service for anything 6v.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: they work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Price, Quality, Price, Quality, Ease of use, from motorcycle battery to dual dodge diesel batteries. keeps them ready for use. I checked the battery water level in the pickup and small motorcycle battery and found them still at the full mark after 7 months. I use the pickup once a month and the motorcycle more often and they are always ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Berg

customer_reviews.title: Defaults to 12 volt with loss of AC power
customer_reviews.text: After a power outage, the unit defaults to 12 volts. With a maintainer, the idea is to leave it on, particularly during extend periods of not using the machine. I checked some time after hooking it up and it was apparent that the charger had fried the 6 volt battery on my bike. If they would put in hard wired voltage selection switch the unit would probably work fine, but if you are using it on a 6 volt battery, this is a fatal flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Great little charger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my original battery in my 2015 Corvette started hesitating when I would try to start it after several days of sitting - which Corvettes do in the winter. This trickle charger worked so well that I'm not going to spend the $250 a new battery would cost me. I go out, unplug it, and the car starts right up. I don't worry about it starting after I let it sit a couple of nights without using the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Mind Driver

customer_reviews.title: Failed after very light use
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after used 3 or 4 times in one year. Update Feb 15 2019: The Amazon Seller - LEICESTERCN Direct, inquired with me about the problems experienced with the charger and offered a new replacement or a partial refund, half of the original cost. One star added to the original review for the prompt customer service response.
customer_reviews.author: CRISTIAN POPA

customer_reviews.title: Sadly stopped working within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this, enough that I customized the wires they include. However, after about 2 weeks of use it stopped working. I'm not sure if there was an electrical spike but it was on a surge protector. Since I customized the wires I wasn't sure about RMAing it since I can't really send back all the components. I may have just got a faulty unit.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My battery is running low and I went for a battery test. The battery is not necessarily bad, but it cannot be fully charged for less driving dyring tbe pandemic. I bought this charger and it works well. It took several hours to fully charge my car battery and I no longer need to worry about low battery.
customer_reviews.author: WhenUBlive

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May and it lasted until August. The part broke open as seen in the pic and stopped working. I never give bad reviews, but felt it deserved my time to let others know to beware of this product...
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rennick

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 with this Battery charger maintainer.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't always go into float mode tested on two batteries, charges but only went to float mode on one not the other (kept charging way above 14.0v) maybe it's the battery maybe the charger. Just a note keep an eye on it or it may overcharge your battery ( and yes I used a volt meter).
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use. My sport bike uses some battery power unlike my Harley. I keep the sport bike plugged in about 80% of the time it is parked in my garage. I have been using this for over 6 months and have had no overcharge or heating issue to date. Still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carrier Aviator Retired

customer_reviews.title: Works great easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and thoroughly charged my truck battery that kept dying only after a day or two that I let go for a couple weeks.... Charged the battery overnight and it’s been two weeks now. The trucks battery is still strong, truck starts without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Randel

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to charge 6V and 12 batteries BUT this cannot charge 6V batteries as there is NO 6V mode switch. Item shown in Amazon is different from what actually they sent (Look at the picture of the front panel of the unit). This will be returned!!!!
customer_reviews.author: cariyawa

customer_reviews.title: buzzing
customer_reviews.text: buzzing sound which should not be normal. buzzed on 3 diff batteries. one is brand new, wanted to give it a full charge, the others are few years old but the charger buzzes. should have stuck with name brand charger. had battery Jr by deltran in past but it got lost when I traded a car in so tried to save a few bucks and this is what I get.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for his motorcycle and he hasn’t had any issues with it. Works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Making sure to try the unit and check it to see if it heats up
customer_reviews.text: This unit works for the first couple of hours but it gets hot after 3 hour. I have a well ventilated area and the ambient temp was cool . I called the company and they said that it has the over heat control but my unit was so hot that I felt burning sensation when I tried to remove it from the outlet. They are sending me a replacement and I hope this doesn’t heat up and the previous one was just a defective unit. Fill report on this later. .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised and can be permanently installed.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my garaged car that is not used often enough to charge its own battery. In two days (or maybe three) it changed that car's battery from half charged to full. Now I don't have to think about how many days from previous use until today so that I can prevent trying to start on a nearly depleted battery. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Fausto

customer_reviews.title: Great trickle/float charger but could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The alligator clips were easy to use and the quick disconnect feature is very handy. Wish the extension was a bit longer and the cover for the quick disconnect was water tight. I've fastened the eyelids to the battery terminals and so they will remain connected to the battery permanently. This means, I will have to make the quick disconnect watertight somehow.
customer_reviews.author: 5HADE

customer_reviews.title: Keeping batteries charged
customer_reviews.text: Better information display on the unit than the others I've tried. Easy installation, connect it and let it work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal Good for the Battery
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to use at a good price point. This is much better than the non-charge controlled 2 amp charger I had been using; the status LED's are useful and due to the staged charging the batteries will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Howard M Karse

customer_reviews.title: Good deal and must have to charge ATV battery.
customer_reviews.text: The size is small and the LED is informative. The instruction manual should have in the english section the same page explaining the unit display in Japanese section. The unit works. I left the charger over night to charge the battery with less than 50 percent capacity. It never got warm. Must have for ATV battery.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Creek

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Works. This is a good sign :-) Makes a little humming sound, but I can live with it. I like the led indicators. I also noticed, while charging, the battery makes a bubling sound. I gues the charging current must be hight towards the final stage of charging. I will review thiss thing more after using it longer. I will be back...
customer_reviews.author: Roman Vlkolinsky

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd Charger by this Company really like their chargers. I use them to charge & maintain 50cc Scooter batteries & it does a great job outside in the cold. I highly recommend. This time though wasn’t impressed that the clamps r now plastic. Just makes them feel cheap. But still performs Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Gray

customer_reviews.title: Will save a lot of money from needing to buy new batteries in the spring
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked well keeping the batteries from discharging over the winter, and then freezing. Batteries today cost well over $100, and this item is well worth it. Plus, for vehicles that aren't driven often, a person doesn't have to have it jumped started just to move it over while is storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charger and maintainer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this charger for maintaining battery's on ATV and riding mower, hard wired to ATV with provided connecter mounted on handlebars, just have to plug in as it is already hard wired to the battery. With the riding mower used the provided battery clamps to battery. A good buy
customer_reviews.author: Airbear41

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. Nice compact design
customer_reviews.text: Needed a trickle charger for my Kawasaki 1600 cc. This worked perfect. Initially battery was completely dead and . figured i needed a new battery but after charging overnight its back up and working fine. Comes with clamps in case of jump start. Has overload protection. I keep it charged 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Yount

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to operate charger
customer_reviews.text: I used the charger to charge the battery in my hybrid 11K Watts generator. It was very easy to unplug the cables, connect the charging clips, and start the charging process. My only complain is the charging time. It took almost 12 hours or more to fully charge the battery. I was expecting a faster charging time at 1.5 Amps.
customer_reviews.author: am8850

customer_reviews.title: Over heated battery
customer_reviews.text: I have several motorcycles with wet cell 12-volt batteries that I keep connected to a batter charger/tender and have one mini bike that has a 6-volt battery, so I purchased the LST Trickle Battery Charger Automatic Maintainer because it was rated for 6-volt wet cell batteries. I attached it and checked on it the following day and found it had heated the battery up and acid had overflowed. It was my understanding that it was automatic and would not cause a wet cell battery to overflow.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: worthwhile purchase for smaller batteries
customer_reviews.text: this 6v & 12v combination charger is great for smaller batteries used in lawnmowers, motorcycles, emergency lights, and alarm system, but is makes a slight buzzing sound when charging. for the price it is a good purchase and gets the job done. if you need to charge larger batteries, you should purchase a large unit. I did not rate the "battery life" since it is not applicable.
customer_reviews.author: glen

customer_reviews.title: Defaults to 12V when powered on
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps there is some internal protection but I cannot understand why this was designed this way and I refuse to use it on a 6V as it scares me too much. When you plug it in it goes to 12V. You push the button and now its on 6V. What happens if the power goes out? It will then default to 12V. Maybe it will cut itself off? Maybe it will switch to 6V? I don't know but I'm sure not going to try it myself. Voltage selection should have just been made with a hard switch. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: You can pretend to be Rambo with this
customer_reviews.text: I like to pretend that I'm Rambo, chained to an old metal box spring from some communist Utopia, and that Dolph lundgren has just hooked this up to my areolas, in order to get vital military information out of me...
customer_reviews.author: Guermo Torres

customer_reviews.title: the battery in the 4 wheeler went bad, even though this charger showed fully charged
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these to maintain the battery in my 4 wheeler at our ranch. Within a month, the battery in the 4 wheeler went bad, even though this charger showed fully charged. When I removed the charger, the battery voltage dropped until it was really dead. Weird! I have no idea what happened. I also have one attached to my tractor, that one is fine.
customer_reviews.author: aKent

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am quite surprised at how well this product works. I had it on a lawn mower and also my ATV. It works great. The one drawback is the unit plugs into the power socket or extension cord and takes up more room than a cord would. Time will tell about the durability. Winter is long and cold here. If it works through the winter in the unheated shed, I will be very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought this charger to keep my car battery alive while car sits in garage for the (very cold) winter. Directions for installing were very clear. Lights on face of device make it easy to see if battery is fully charged. Good value. Don't know how well it will keep battery charged until end of winter, when I disconnect it.
customer_reviews.author: Moondog

customer_reviews.title: worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I keep a car in in the garage. I seldom use it and sometimes the battery runs down after several months. This worked great for me. I used it to charge the battery overnight. It was easy. Price was good
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: My riding lawn mower's battery went dead due to sitting over the winter. I purchased this and gave it a full charge and it has been working great. Using this was easy and the information lights tell you just when it is fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Batteries don't seem to last as long as they used to. I'm trying to get another year or two out of my batteries by using this on my tractors. Too early to know if battery life will be extended but the tractors do start better when topped off with this device. It also makes me feel better that I am trying to do something to make batteries last longer.
customer_reviews.author: spots

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful little unit.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait before reviewing this since its important to get some use out of a product first. This unit was absolutely perfect for what I needed. I kept it on my motorcycle all season and it never failed me, and I even used it twice to drink my battery back from dead (Left the key on). The included clamps are great for quickly connecting to a battery that has not been wired and I used that to charge up my ATV and Lawn Tractor.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Best trickle battery charger!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this LST trickle battery charger. It is everything the video on Amazon said it would do. You can’t make any mistakes with it. I already recommended to my family and friends, and I highly recommend it to you too. Great price, great value!
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Do not leave unattended, mine did not stop charging.
customer_reviews.text: Overcharged a motorcycle battery. The electrolytes started boiling. The charge level was 14.7 on a battery that isn't suppose to hold a charge over 12.6. it does however charge slowly I recommend never leaving alone.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I letf a trickle charge fro 2 months on my card and it started on the first try. I'm very happy with this charger.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap build quality
customer_reviews.text: It does get the job done but build quality is absolute garbage . Feels like its a 1 dollar cord with 1 dollar clams on it . Charger it self gets really hot after couple of hours and im afraid to leave it over night every time , i got a feeling it will burn my house down when i sleep .
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lox

customer_reviews.title: work well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these at a time I was having battery issues. Both of them did what was required of them; charged the batteries with low current and cut off when done. Be sure to disconnect from the battery when not charging as they will slowly discharge the battery
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: 6 or 12 Volt Float Charger
customer_reviews.text: This device provides a low amperage (3.0) sampling charge to my 90 year old vintage automobile with virtually no concern for overcharging/overheating the vehicle battery when no one is watching.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Good unit at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and works with a battery tender pigtail, so that is worth a lot. Seems to work just fine, the only thing I can't comment on is how long will it last. Satisfied so far and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: DeBard

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6V ride on toys but needs adapter for 6V plug
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product I can use for my daughters 6V ride on toys used in conjunction with a Schumacher TAH6V 6V Battery Cable...  . I love that it tells you when the battery is fully charged. The one gripe I have is that you have to manually put the charger in 6V mode everytime you use it because the default setting is 12V. Great product though and i would absolutely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik O.

customer_reviews.title: Unsure about product at this time. I hate say this is happen to often.
customer_reviews.text: So for first unit I used did not charge my 12v battery after 12 hours, plus it got warm. I not sure about leaving them unintended in my barn so for not working as per write up. Terry Wilie
customer_reviews.author: T L Wilie

customer_reviews.title: A great little battery maintainer!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and works like a charm! I use it to maintain the battery on a car that’s parked a lot and it’s a perfect battery saver. The only downside were the instructions were not that good but I was able to find guidance on the internet. Very good value for the money too!
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Provides indications
customer_reviews.text: Works well and the displayed information regarding the charge status of the battery is most reassuring. The only nit is the persistent beeping; although low volume, it never stops and it's irritating
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ruffa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent charger for Champion generator battery.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to setup. Has an extension section for longer reach. Has both rings for battery posts and clamps. Bright visible LED display to indicate status. The 1.5 Amp charging rate is exactly the specification I needed.
customer_reviews.author: rwsani

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: i'm not sure as of yet how well it will keep my battery charged until i go to use it this coming summer. it is hooked up to battery/maintaining and both green lights are staying on the charger. only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: GUN GUY

customer_reviews.title: Not as nice as Battery Tender
customer_reviews.text: Cannot rate durability since I just got the unit. The leads from the charger to the wall plug transformer are shorter than the battery tender I already have requiring a short extension cord to plug in. The alligator clips to attach to the battery posts are not very robust either.
customer_reviews.author: PPP

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This unit is small and it works great. It charges your vehicles battery as stated. You just need to have an outlet to plug the unit into that's near your vehicle so that the units cords can reach your battery.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Never used a batter tender type device like this one before. Always used my old Sears car battery charger to charge up my boat's marine batteries. No wonder they didn't last. This 5 amp tender is great. Easy to use. Keeps my new Interstate deep cycle battery charged up perfectly. I mounted the Battery Tender to the wall in my garage where I keep my boat battery. Love how I can just plug it in and forget about it! Seeing that solid green light on lets me know I'll never have to worry about my battery being charged before I go fishing. Very cool so far.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cleary

product_meta.title: LST Trickle Battery Charger Automatic Maintainer 6V 12V Smart Float Charger for Automotive Car Motorcycle Lawn Mower Tractor SLA ATV AGM GEL CELL Lead Acid Batteries
feature_bullets: √ Battery and Vehicle Type - Charge fully drained 6V&12V pb/sla/gel/agm/lead-acid batteries, it's automatic battery trickle chargers for automotive, motorcycles, automobile, riding lawn mowers, lawn tractor, ATVs, RVs, watercraft, powersport, scooter, snowmobiles, cars, camper, trolling motor, boats, etc

√ Safety Guarantee - Multi protection against Reverse Polarity, Short Circuit, Over Voltage/Current, Over Charge/Discharge, Overload, Overheat; Spark proof during lead connection; Water and dust resistant float battery charger, full-loaded and burn-in test proves its stable performance and high reliability.

√ 5-Stage Automatic Charging - Featured detachable ring or alligator connectors with 10A fuse, charge and maintain your battery wherever you go; Monitor the whole charging process, automatically switches to float mode after fully charging the battery by MCU controlled; LST motorcycle battery charger will recover batteries more effectively and extend the battery life.

√ Intuitive LED Indicator - LST 6/12 volt automotive battery maintainer charger provide visual state-of-charge feedback and diagnostic information, even when in maintenance mode. Input 100-240V, ultra-compact and lightweight, easy to carry the motorcycle charger everywhere.

√ 100% Satisfactory Float Charger - Updated with defective battery recognition function and 72-hour safety features, just get portable 6v 12v trickle charger for car batteries with confidence; LST smart battery charger offer 3-Year quality assurance & 12-Month refund & timely 24/7 after-sale services.
